title: Breathing Just A Little
features: 'Breathing Just A Little' is a poignant collection of poems that explore themes of vulnerability, love, relationships, identity and loneliness. This is a book that compels and reaches out to the 'softness' in us all; a moving, tender and honest collection that transcends all boundaries. A collection that is guaranteed to leave your soul aching; wondering how it is possible, someone you have never met, can articulate your thoughts so well.
description: Farah Gabdon is a performance poet, writer and English teacher from London, by way of Somalia. With a degree in Creative Writing, she has captivated audiences with her writing and performance poetry across London and Europe.
